6516561:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 65yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 27.5mm RLL nodule that was ground-glass on CT, bronchus sign was negative, PET showed SUV 16.3.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Fujifilm EB-580S scope with 22g needle and sampled stations 11R x2, 4R x4, 11L x3, ROSE was there and showed Malignant - small cell carcinoma at multiple stations.

then switched to Galaxy robot and navigated to the RLL superior (B6) lesion, registration was 2.8mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing eccentric view and did tool in lesion confirmation with cbct. took 4 forceps bx, 3 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Adequate lymphocytes, no malignancy.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Steven Park md
ip attending
